bill_title: to revise the minerals and materials that may be mined under a mining license, to revise certain cement plant reporting requirements, and to revise the requirements for signatures on certain cement plant leases and conveyances.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the minerals and materials that may be mined under a mining license, to revise certain cement plant reporting requirements, and to revise the requirements for signatures on certain cement plant leases and conveyances. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 45-6-65 be amended to read as follows: 45-6-65. An operator shall obtain a license to mine for sand, gravel, rock to be crushed and used in construction, pegmatite minerals or for limestone, iron ore, sand, gypsum, or shale , pozzolan, or other materials used in the process of making cement or lime. The operator shall comply with the requirements of § § 45-6-68, 45-6-69, 45-6-71, and 45-6-72 for each site to be mined. Failure to comply with these requirements for each site mined constitutes mining without a valid license. The fee for the license is an annual fee of one hundred dollars, which shall be deposited in the environment and natural resources fee fund established in § 1-40-30 by the department. Section 2. That § 5-17-11 be repealed. 5-17-11. The cement plant shall at the close of each calendar quarter report to the state director of old age and survivor's insurance the amount of employer's tax upon the employees of the state cement plant, and shall remit to the director of old age and survivor's insurance a sum of money which equals such amount with the report. Section 3. That § 5-17-17 be amended to read as follows: 5-17-17. The money received from the sale or lease of such real property shall be deposited by the secretary of the Cement Plant Commission in the State Cement Plant Fund. On the approval of the sale, lease or exchange of any such real property by the state Cement Plant Commission the conveyance or lease of said the real property shall be made in the name of the state of South Dakota by and through the state Cement Plant Commission and shall be executed by the chairman of the commission and attested by the secretary-treasurer thereof and approved in writing thereon by the Governor . Section 4. That § 5-17-32 be repealed. 5-17-32. Such cement plant commission or its designees shall file in the office of the secretary of state every three months a statement showing the financial condition of the business conducted under authority of this chapter and such other information as may be of public interest.
